CommentsTitle: Locking is shotty, opens too easily.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2017
CommentsContent: This was perfect in every way when I first got it.  After a few months, the locking mechanism got less and less effective to the point where it opened inside of the pocket and when I sat down it gave me a laceration that needed stitches.  The possible medical bills aren't worth the cheap cost of the knife.  I wish I could give a good review as I love the aesthetic of the product and it was useful when it was functional.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2016
CommentsContent: I have never owned a pocket knife in my life, but after binging LNM on Reddit for awhile, I thought it time I took my safety seriously. So I got this knife with the Prime membership & boy am I obsessed with it. The blade is legitimately super sharp and means business. I love the rainbow, it looks incredible when it hits light just right. I got down the one-hand open / close in about 5 minutes, it does open and close fast like the description stated. The bottle opener / screwdriver or glass breaker is such a nice perk to it. I hope I never have to use it to defend myself but if I do, I know I am in good hands with this product. Will recommend to others!!!

CommentsTitle: Beautiful, Sharp, and easy to use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I have to admit, I was ordering one for my bf and decided to order one for myself purely because of how beautiful it was lol it is a really good knife though. It’s easy to open, the blade it really sharp and also has a nice serrated part. I also like how it has a little clip so you can attach it to your bag or pants or whatever. I use it mainly to open boxes and stuff and it does a great job at that! I’m sure it can be used for many other tasks as well

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The knife is pretty, and it would probably be a sweet blade if it worked properly. Alas... The bottom of the blade is not properly aligned with the liner lock, and the lock will not snap into place when the blade is opened. This means the knife will not stay locked open, making it entirely likely that I will close it on my fingers if I make any attempt to use it. My fingers have done nothing to deserve this fate, therefore, I will not be using this knife. Unfortunately, I tossed it in a corner and forgot about it until it was too late to return it. Maybe I'll put it on display somewhere...First picture shows faulty locking mechanism. Second picture is just for you to admire its technicolor beauty. Disregard the scuff marks around the screws - I took it apart completely to see if I could fix the alignment myself. (Obviously, I could not.)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 14, 2020
CommentsContent: My family loves camping and scouting, and as such, we use pocketknives frequently. Of the four of us who have a knife, three of us have this one, and we LOVE them! I've got the orange, and my two sons have the rainbow ones. The blade locks effectively, and if you take care of the knife - keep it clean, etc - it won't malfunction. I like the belt clip feature so that it doesn't slide around in my pocket or risk falling out - women's pockets are a JOKE, so this is really important to me. It's easy enough to open/close for children to use with proper supervision, and it holds up to vigorous use in the wilderness. We've used our knives for everything: whittling, carving, cutting off chunks of fat wood, even cutting potatoes and onions when the kitchen knives in our packs failed. I've used them to cut bandages for first aid, and so much more. Awesome, versatile, high quality knife. When my youngest gets his first pocketknife in a month or two, we'll be getting another one of these.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2020
CommentsContent: First off, be careful because this is extremely sharp. I was playing with it when I first got it and cut my finger because I was not careful enough. So that is good point for sharpness of the knife.Easy to open (although I cannot personally do it one handed) but stays locked so it will not open accidentally.I've carried it in my purse for quite a long time and it's been super handy and convenient to have around for opening and cutting things when needed. Blade doesn't seem to have dulled noticeably either.I liked it enough to buy a replacement one when my idiot self accidentally left it in my purse and had it confiscated at the airport (oops). Ordered the new one as soon as I got home from my travels. (:The rainbow color is a nice option as well.

CommentsTitle: Amazingly nice for this incredibly low price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2019
CommentsContent: I paid $7 for this knife and am absolutely blown away by its quality. Its NOT a $200 knife, but its every bit as nice as many $60 knives I've owned. Smooth to the touch, not exceptionally heavy (though slightly heavier than an expensive brand name.)The spring assisted opening is perfectly made, just tight enough not to pop open, but lose enough that it doesn't take a ton of effort to launch it when you want it.I cant say firmly enough how much nicer this knife is than anything else for even 5 times as much money.Improve: I'd love to have the bottle opener work with the knife closed. Or, even better would be to use it as a strap cutter with the knife blade inside it when closed. Would like some more color choices.But, if you've read this far: buy this knife. Its great, especially for the price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 23, 2016
CommentsContent: This knife which is under 15$ is your best option in this price range. I have had this knife for several months and the blade is just as sharp as the day I received it. It has a belt clip, a bottle opener and a glass breaker on the bottom of the handle. The stub on the side that is used to swing out the blade is extremely useful and fast. The weight of the knife is nice and lets us know this is not cheaply made, you are not losing quality and still spending a small amount of money for what you get. The blade always stays locked in and has not became loose over the several months I have had it. There is no hassle when using this knife, it is very dependable. This Tactical knife is ideal for any situation, it holds up and may surprise you on how well it holds up. I have used it to open boxes at my job to cutting rope on camping trips. Very convenient knife for whatever you may need it, not to mention the versatile colors that are available for the knife are incredible. Overall a bang for your buck and I recommend this knife without hesitation to anyone in search of one.

CommentsTitle: Took me awhile to figure out how to close it. :-)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2018
CommentsContent: I'm a woman with small hands, I can open it one-handed but not easily, needs practice. To close it, on the inside just below the blade, right on the curved serrated-like area, you just push down (meaning: with the blade at your left, sharp edge toward you, push the inside part 'downward' toward the ground. You can see how it goes up to the outer-blade area and 'releases' it). Then close with fingers while pushing down with thumb. I can't fully do this yet, I think my hands are a little too small. Anyway, the knife is weighty, seems pretty solid. And of course: it's truly lovely.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2018
CommentsContent: I am a first responder and my husband wanted to get me a knife for Christmas. This knife is very hard to open one handed and once the blade is out, it does not lock. It also gets stuck just before the blade is fully closed. Tried to get money back, which hasn't worked out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this thing. All the positive reviews are spot on. It's got a great weight to it. Feels strong and sturdy. I've had it about 2 months now and I have had no issues. It was really stiff for awhile there. Hard to open and close one handed without breaking a nail...yes I broke a nail trying to open and close this knife. True story. But it seems to slowly be getting more loose where it opens and closes easier. But not loose loose...just getting broken in. It still takes a bit of effort to pop it open one handed. Then again I have small female hands. Over all, love this knife. Really sharp. Great size. 10-10 all around.

CommentsTitle: It's a 20 dollar knife for less than 10 dollars
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2020
CommentsContent: Opens easily with a flick of the flipper one-handed. Blade color is beautiful. Feels sturdy but not heavy. No play in blade when locked . Lock has not failed to engage nor has it shown any tendency to disengage prematurely. Edge is sharp but not razor sharp. If you are one of those people that needs a blade that sharp then this is probably not the best choice. It is sharp though and the serrations are also quite sharp. Bottle opener is slightly more useful than the one on my CRKT Pryma. Haven't tried the glass breaker. A little harder to close one-handed but it can be done. Its just a little more awkward so not as smooth to close as it is to open. I am happy as a pig in sheet with this knife.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I was really excited for my knife, only to realize that it was extremely hard to open. I know how to, but it made my fingers hurt alot because I had to press on the little mechanism IMMENSELY hard to open it. My fingers are still sore after not touching it for 12 hours. Also not to mention when I do get it to spring up, it doesn't even come up all the way and I have to lock it into place by hand. At first I thought I was doing it wrong or just weak but after watching videos and speaking to someone who has the same knife, I realized this is just a faulty product. But you get what you pay for I suppose.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2020
CommentsContent: This knife is super cool and I really like the style and design. However, if you’re not currently playing with it, it is very very very stiff to get to open. I’ve played with it for hours, put oil on it and it still stays very very stiff. Usually my knives are easy to open by this point and this one is not. It is super sharp and awesome tho and it was a great value!

CommentsTitle: Review after one year of use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2016
CommentsContent: Had this knife for nearly a year at this point. It's overall, a very good knife. I have used this knife for near daily, for smacking, cutting ripping, but primarily as a box cutter. Biggest issue, a week ago the screw came out of the bottom of the knife, did not come all the way out though. I'll have to wait until I can get a Hexwrench to see if I can get it back in. The bottle opener only functions when the knife is out. which seems really dangerous to open bottles with, although that didn't really stop me. The blade scratched, but held up pretty decently, and the color is still very vibrant.Also the blade has bent slightly, it was worse at one point but I have managed to getting back into shape for the most part. Decent. Good buy.PRO: Sturdy.cheap.pretty.cons:poorly placed bottle openerThe black paint on the grip wore off, very quickly. In under a month.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: The knife on its own is flashy and cool. The handle has a fantasy quality and the blade itself a nice holographic.  I opened it and was pleased, until i actually touched it. The grip is somewhat uncomfortable with ridges in awkward places. The latch has smaller grip ridges on either side and is difficult to use if you have bigger fingers. In addition to that, i discovered it to be rather dull out of the box, and very difficult to sharpen due to the aforementioned unpleasant grip. The rainbow sheen proved to be impossible to keep clean: the slightest touch gives it an unattractive smudgey look, not to mention how easily it scratches off.  I suppose there was little better to expect, as i did buy a 10 dollar pocket knife, but i am nevertheless annoyed by the inconsistency of quality. A year or so ago i bought a TAC force knife, (black blade w/ faux wood handle) and it has served me very well! It needs to be sharpened a little more often than my higher-quality knifes, but other than has a very comfortable grip. Very disappointed with this more colorful purchase, howeverTl;dr overall, not a great knife. Awkward to hold, difficult to use, and you're better off saving your money for a better one

CommentsTitle: Gorgeous, sturdy, all around great buy
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2016
CommentsContent: So I haven't actually had an opportunity to put this to any actual use yet, but just based on general inspection and playing around with it this seems like a pretty nice knife, especially for the price. It has a nice weight to it, feels pretty balanced and nice in my hand (it's a little heavier in the handle than on the blade, the center of balance is a bit past the halfway point - which I like). The screws and hardware and such all look fine, nothing feels loose or doesn't work properly. It is a little bit stiff both opening and closing, personally I like the amount of resistance there is when opening it, it's not too hard to open (somehow a friend of mine - a grown male friend at that - had some issues with it and I ended up having to open it for him but he's kind of an idiot so I think he COULD'VE opened it but was doing something wrong? Even though I'm not sure WHAT you could actually do wrong, it's pretty straightforward...) but it's not so easy that it might come open when it brushes up against something; so as long as you don't have some sort of weird ragdoll fingers that can't press down on things you should be ok haha (I'm sure this could vary some between knives though, so if it WAS too hard to open you could probably either wd40 it or loosen up the blade screw ever so slightly). The lock is a little stiff as well, not horribly so, but I do find myself not pushing it QUITE far enough in and then having to adjust a little more to get the blade folded back in, which only takes an extra fraction of a second so again, not a big deal at all just slightly... not even annoying really, just barely notable enough for me to mention it - also there is still some resistance once you're fully clear of the locking mechanism so you may initially think you haven't fully pushed it aside but once you push down a little harder on the blade it'll fold up just fine.The blade itself is pretty sharp straight out of the box, I'll probably sharpen it some anyway around the tip because I like to keep my knives as sharp as possible at all times but this is by no means necessary, in fact I managed to put a little cut in my thumbnail when I was messing around with it haha and with little to no effort at that. Because of this as well as the price point and quality I think this would be a great 'starter knife', to carry around and try out as an edc to see if you even use it enough to warrant buying a sharpener or a more expensive knife. I also think it would also make a great gift, and you won't need to open the box and sharpen it before you give it to them (in fact I actually bought a second one for my friend).My final thought on this, and I'm sure you will see many other people mention this if you haven't already, is that this thing is SO gorgeous. I got the rainbow/oil slick color, and I knew it would look good just based on other reviewers' pictures, but still figured I'd bring it up because it's just so cool looking in person, everyone who's seen it has commented on it.Overall this is a great buy, I am so happy with it and I think anyone else would be too so I recommend this 100%. I don't really have much to add to what anyone else has already said about this so I'm really just agreeing with all the other people who loved this knife but I hope this was helpful regardless, and I hope everyone reading this has a great day!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2017
CommentsContent: First off, it's cheap, so I halfway expected all of my following complaints.  Both arrived relatively sharp, but the first time I tried cutting rope with them they dulled almost instantly.  Cheaply built: made in china, and the rivet that acts as a pivot point for the blade came loose after a couple weeks.  Buy this if you want to cut yarn or string, don't expect a heavy duty knife... again, look how much it costs.  Also, the "bottle opener"  has such a wide gap that it even fails at effectively opening bottles.  Looks good though.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2019
CommentsContent: By no means am I a knife expert, in fact- I know nothing about knifes. I’ve never owned a knife until now, and this one I purchased for personal protection. I will say, for $10, this knife seems perfect. It’s simple to use and and sharp. It’s heavy, seems like great quality. As you can see, Olaf approves. In fact, he seems excited. Hopefully I never have to actually use the knife, but if I do, I’ll be sure to update my review! If this review never gets updated either A. I never had to use it. Or B. I tried to use it and the knife did not work and I died.  But as of now, so far so good! Cool knife, great purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this as a christmas gift for my sister. Be careful when handling this knife though because she was trying to open something up using this knife and she cut herself really bad. That was a mistake on her part but it's a really sharp knife right outta the box so fair warning. Good knife for the price, it looks really nice with the rainbow like effect on the blade.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Full disclosure: I am no knife expert, or even a knife enthusiast. I'm sure someone with deeper knowledge could tell you why this isn't nearly as high-quality as an expensive one. That said, it certainly cuts boxes, slits tape and splits cable ties like a madman, and that's good enough for me. Does so at least as well as the Kershaw Brawler I stupidly lost and bought this to replace, in fact. Again, more of a "knife guy" could quite likely tell you why the Brawler justifies its considerably higher price... but for my purposes, the TF-705RB keeps up just fine. Bought the rainbow version on a lark, and heaven help me, I like that too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2016
CommentsContent: I just received my knife really fast which is awesome because I was told I would get it in 3-5 days but I got it in 2! I ordered it on a Thursday night & got it that Saturday afternoon. The box that the knife comes in is just a simple cardboard box, nothing fancy. But, when you open it & take the knife out you will definitely be impressed. It does not look or feel cheap at all. It looks & feels like a knife you would pay $30-50 for, in my opinion. At the top of the knife you'll notice a little piece that you push to open the knife. When I first tried it It stuck a little but after opening it a few times it flicks right open. It doesn't feel like it will get loose any time soon though but if it does you can just tighten it if you need to. Just like many other knives, under the blade there is a rigid piece that you push to the side to close the knife. On the back there is a clip so that you can clip your knife onto whatever you'd like to clip it on. I was really impressed with how sharp the knife is as well. Another reviewer said they would give the knife a 7/10 on sharpness & I agree. If there's is a con it would be that you can only use the bottle opener when the knife is open. That doesn't bother me but it might bother someone else. Just be cautious & you won't hurt yourself. There's also a part at the end of the knife that you would use if you need to break a window. Overall, I think this is a great buy. I loved it so much I bought my best friend one & now her dad wants one too. I can't wait to try it out when we hunt & fish. I would definitely recommend this knife & buy more TAC-Force products.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I made a review but not sure if it posted, and I was  talking about the switch mechanism and how it’s not the best. Update: it’s fine I just needed help. It’s not really a “switch” but I guess that’s good for safety. From the videos I watched it seemed you could just switch and flick it open and press it close but it takes more hands on than that and again that’s good for safety.  I like it and it gets the job done for me as a “beginner”!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought this for my 15 year old daughter so she can easily cut strings on hay bales when feeding her cow.  She loves it!  She can easily open it and shut it without feeling like she is going to cut herself.  She uses it for everything she can, opening gifts, cutting packages, out on the farm.  She even loves to compare it to her dads and say it’s better.  He even tested it out and really was impressed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2017
CommentsContent: This knife is AMAZING!! The rainbow color is beautiful. The knife blade color is not exactly the same as the picture shows, but has more colors in it than just pink and blue. I actually like that better, because I got it for my friend (who is a boy)'s birthday.Some of the other reviews said that it was kind of hard to open with one hand at first, which is true. But it gets quite smooth after a couple practices, and is also very easy to close.It is very sharp, and the serrated edge is helpful. The knife came quickly. It would be very good for cutting slim rope.It's a very good camping knife, where the bottle opener would come in handy.I think this knife at least deservs five stars. I'd give it six if I could.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I like the weight, shape, and color of this knife. It’s sharp and does wonders when I need to use it like a Swiss Army knife, luckily I haven’t used it for personal defense, but I feel safe with this on me wherever I go along with other lines of defense. My niece got the same one as me and I helped her get use to unlocking it and closing it. My knife has gotten loose from opening it throughout the years, but that’s a good thing in my opinion because I like being able to open it easily, so be aware that the lock may loosen with time and usage.

CommentsTitle: My favorite knife to give to people who don't have knifes
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020
CommentsContent: It's a great knife for the price. While it may not be as "refined" as some of the more expensive knifes I've carried it makes up for it by being stupidly simple. The blade is fairly sturdy, hard and comes sharp. It opens extremely easily and has a satisfying locking click. I can sit there and open it a hundred times. It's honestly all I have ever asked for from an edc knife. Definitely 100% worth the $10.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2019
CommentsContent: 1 - this knife is pretty. Like, really pretty. Which isn't really why I bought it, but I'm not mad at it. 2 - This knife is hard to figure out how to close. I was suuper embarressed when it took me, like, 5 min to figure it out. You can find videos on YouTube, and it's really easy when you know how! 3 - This knife WORKS. I cut open packages and trim loose threads off my clothes and feel extremely secure walking home alone late at night and just about anything else you might want to have a knife for. It fits discreetly in my purse and is easy to open and close (but still locks securely!) and I love it.

CommentsTitle: For The value 1 out of 3 is still good odds.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2018
CommentsContent: Received item as pictured and described. Arrived as expected. love the rainbow color. No fading or wearing. The spring assist works roughly and due to a machine flaw the blade doesn’t clear the flange that locks the blade. I purchased 3 of these knives from this seller (orange, camo and rainbow) and all 3 looked great and all 3 had to be adjusted for faster blade release but I find this to be overall a minimal inconvenience. This knife is defective but will attempt to hone flange and reassemble knife for continued and improved use. Still would buy from seller and would buy knife again. Value is justified, this was defect product.

CommentsTitle: My expectations weren't high but I'm blown away
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2017
CommentsContent: Awesome quality. Very nice heft to the knife. And the price Omg! Unbelievable how cheap and how amazing this knife is. Bottle opener is weirdly placed but who cares I use it as a last resort. Glass breaker is nice as well. I'm not into serrated blades but it is very sharp on this knife as well as the blade. Very good packaging as well. The finish on the knife is breath taking! Super smooth blade and visually cool. I took it out the first weekend I got it up wheeling in the woods. And i got compliments from all the guys saying how cool it was and how great the price was. Thanks tac force for solid knife at a great price!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2020
CommentsContent: The price was really right on these knives! I got them as bridesmaids gifts and I'm on a seriously tight budget! Was happy to when they came so I could verify they were actually what was pictured because the price was so good. My only complaint is that 2 of the knives are much more difficult to close. They get "stuck" and that's annoying BUT for such a good deal I can't really be that upset.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2017
CommentsContent: I have several of these. They are inexpensive, sharpen up pretty well, and the "oil slick" colorization on the blade makes them easy to locate from a distance. I know it says that this knife has a bottle opener on it, but be advised that the knife has to be opened to use the bottle opener. The bottle opener had no bearing on me getting this knife, and that it why it still gets 5 stars even with the unsafe bottle opener. Of course, like most knives these days, this knife is made China. Not the kind of knife you get to be a family heirloom, but a great inexpensive daily use pocket knife.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2016
CommentsContent: Ok, this knife is just badass!  After seeing the videos about how quick and easy this opens, I had to order me one.  I chose the rainbow option because I've never owned a blade like it before and wanted it to stand out against the other ones I own.  The knife is super sharp and the serrated portion scares me to death!! I'm going to have no problem sawing limbs off small trees with that.  Or cutting through rope if need be.  I love the way it looks like some sort of alien technology.  However, that's where the only drawback (for me) this knife has as it's handle includes a bottle opener feature that when holding the knife, digs into my pinkie finger.  Should I ever need to use it in self-defense, I would have to use a reverse grip so that any strikes wouldn't cause me as much damage as my threat.  All in all, I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Very pleasantly surprised with this knife! Not only does it look totally badass, the spring assisted opening is awesome. After spending some time practicing opening it by swinging the blade out with my thumb, I noticed a small “button” protruding from the knife when it was closed. Whaddaya know? Press the button and the blade opens automatically. Surprise!Nice sharp blade, the serrated section is VERY sharp 😎And the price??? Come on, just get it. You won’t be disappointed!

CommentsTitle: If you’re looking for a working class knife keep looking
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2018
CommentsContent: If you are looking for a working class blade, keep looking. I bought this to use at work while my benchmade is being serviced. I was not expecting anywhere near the same quality seeing as this is one of Amazons cheapest knives.However, here’s my take: the blade is solid and the weight of the knife is heavy. If you are someone who rarely uses a knife this is a fine selection. You can use it for many basic purposes.If you are a person who uses knives multiple times an hour to open boxes, cut zip ties, scrape away material, any type of industrial usage. This is not the blade for you. Do yourself a favor and get a benchmade. Yes they are over $200 but it has a lifetime blade sharpening and repair warranty. So it will pay for itself and always cut better than this $8 titanium.Again if you just want to look cool and occasionally open a box or something this is fine for you.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2018
CommentsContent: Lost my old knife and wanted a quick cheap replacement. I always have a knife on me as they're often useful. This one came with even more uses. While the spring assisted rainbow blade is nice, I got it because it can also double as a glass breaker & a flathead screw driver, and lastly, a bottle opener!I'm no country hick because I drive a truck, I drive a truck because I see it more useful than a car. Same thing with the knife. I'll take something with more uses vs something shiny any day. The fancy rainbow blade is just a nice look & the knife is cheap but well worth it. Tac force is now my way-to-go when it comes to these knives.

CommentsTitle: Pretty and sharp but won’t close!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2021
CommentsContent: I really just got this to carry in my car just in case or when I go for a walk in the woods. So I didn’t realize it had some sort of spring lock and just pulled it open. Pretty and super sharp but now I can’t get it to close! Maybe I’m dumb but nothing is working. If anyone has a tip I’d be grateful!

CommentsTitle: Heavy Piece Of...Seller Does NOT OFFER RETURNS
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2017
CommentsContent: CAVEAT EMPTOR! This seller does not offer returns.This knife is much too heavy, and poorly balanced.  Not to mention dull.  The lever action is very stuff, and closing is very difficult.  Feels like a rock in your pocket.  Overall not a smooth, enjoyable knife for utility, or any other purpose - and definitely not for everyday carrying.Finally, did I mention the seller DOES NOT OFFER RETURNS!?

CommentsTitle: Good knife, especially for the price tag!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I like this knife! You can probably tell by the picture that it's not the most ergonomical design, but it looks pretty cool. It's not uncomfortably to use or anything, it's got a different feel in your hand. The blade is sharp, and so far the edge is holding up great.The autoassist works great, and the knife locks up tight 100% of the time so far. The rainbow finish on the blade looks great, and seems really durable.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2021
CommentsContent: Great little tactical knife!  Has some weight to it, easy to open and easy to secure when locking.  Meets most states requirements for carrying a concealed knife if your plan is to use for self defense.  I got the Rainbow and it is a beautiful blade.  Definitely worth the money and I recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2018
CommentsContent: When I travel between college campuses, I take a couple of buses to do so. Unfortunately, the stop between the two buses is usually very dangerous. I’ve been harassed and almost robbed. I got this knife to help me feel safer. Luckily I haven’t had to use it like I’ve had to use pepper spray, but it’s still nice to have it there just in case. It’s sharp and has a beautiful design. I think what I like the most about it is that I don’t even notice it in my pocket. It fits just right and isn’t obvious. I do wish it would close easier, but that’s a nitpick.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2015
CommentsContent: For the price, you can not go wrong. Out of the package it feels solid and is shave worthy. It is over light use though, when it starts to show it's character. First, the Rainbow blade is very shiny and pretty to look at, but that nice finish isn't going to stay flawless forever. I noticed quickly that the blade began to hold scratches and any kind of oil/fingerprint smudges, but with that said I didn't really buy the knife for it to be perfect all of the time. It gets the job done. Very cheap and reliable. As of construction, it has a nice weight to it.The blade feels very solid and the lock holds well. As for the handle/grip, there isn't much to say. For me I don't like the shape or feel of the grip. My hands get sweaty holding it for some reason, I don't know why. But that might just be me so no points on them. Also the screws in the grip were a concern from the beginning. They didn't feel like they were going to last very long and indeed I was right. Within a month or so one of the screws near the glass breaker was gone. Also a flaw but nothing I worry about too much. It still works fine. Again with the blade, it came very sharp. This shave worthy edge does not last long but is not hard to get back. The blade sharpens very easily but that can be a con as well depending on how you look at it.Overall, it is a great knife with decent construction and function. I just put in order for another for myself and one as a gift to my brother who just lost his $100 boot knife and loved mine for the idea of a decent knife for less than $10. I highly recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2019
CommentsContent: Pros: Looks like the picture, no scuffs or scratches. Very sharp and sleek looking. it’s got a nice comfortable weight & grip to it. It locks completely into place once opened. (I know some people had problems with the knife locking into place).Cons: It’s stiff. It takes some real pressure to push down on the spring action button thing 😂. Even if I try to just pull the knife out I have to use some force and that scares me because I don’t want my hand to slip or the knife to spring out by me using so much force and cut myself. Even the button to close the knife takes pressure to push aside. I’m going to oil it & see if that solves the problem. Or maybe the screws are too tight?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 4, 2018
CommentsContent: For a "Made in China" knife, the blade, sharpness, lock, open-assist, and versatility of the TAC Force TF-705RB-MC is a pretty decent buy.  How well this stands the test of time and durability remains to be seen, but for the price I'm very pleased with my purchase.  I do not anticipate ultra-high use since I only camp once or twice per year, and fish / float from my kayak a few times more.  I was less interested in this being a defense weapon, and more of an occasional tool.  The knife arrived in 2 days per my Prime membership.  It looks kind of cool, too.

CommentsTitle: Nice for what i paid for it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2020
CommentsContent: It's very nice looking and i love that it is heavy. It's not very sharp and it's hard to open. overall I love it for what I PAID for it. I bought another knife from another seller and paid DOUBLE for it and its just OK. This knife is very nice to look at but I will need to sharpen it and maybe see if it needs some oil to help it open easier.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 23, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a well made knife, and a great value for the price. It is very sharp. I have tiny girl hands (lol) and it is easy for me to open and close, which was very important to me and rare with cheap knives. I will admit, I have not tried to cut anything major with it yet, but for smaller things it has been fine and handy to have. It is lightweight and not bulky so it is great to pack. Also, it's pretty. One thing to note though, it is not spring-loaded at all.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2020
CommentsContent: My husband has a love for iridescent metal and knives. Enter, this product. It combined two of his favorite things! I was so excited when I stumbled upon it. His birthday is coming up, but I already gave this to him. (We both have a hard time holding onto presents and not giving them early... lol!) He loves it! It is sturdy. The blade is sharp. Would definitely purchase again.

CommentsTitle: You just cant beat this for the price!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Surprised when I actually liked this knife. I only bought it because it was beautiful and cheap. It arrived as a considerably sturdy knife. Still gorgeous. Flips open with ease. A little tight to close, but better than closing too easy.  Extremely sharp. Id buy it again. Pleasantly surprised.

CommentsTitle: Very pretty blade and easy to open
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: The knife is pretty and springs open nicely. I was opening and closing it about 5 times when I got it today. Then it became VERY difficult to close. I wasn’t able to push the lock to the side to close it, and it was a little jammed. I saw some metal shavings fall off where the lock meets the back of the blade so I think mine needed to be filed a little more before it was assembled. I can still open it when I need to so that’s the important part. I do prefer knives that have an easier close though.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2019
CommentsContent: I was surprised to find this was a nice little knife.  I bought it as a last-minute purchase just before I was going oversees to do some volunteer work. I've owned more expensive versions in the past (i.e. Spyderco) but I found I kept losing them at airports or elsewhere.  The groove for flipping out one handed doesn't quite work for me, so I need to use two hands, but otherwise this works great.  The rainbow coloration is also really cool.  Definitely worth the cost.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought one of these about a year ago for a car emergency kit and loved it. Recently bought 2 more to put in my day packs for hiking. Very sharp and sturdy. If you are a knife enthusiast, then I am sure this isn't for you- stick to Kershaw, Gerber, etc. But, if you are looking for a daily carry that you won't cry if you lose, pick up 1, or 3, of these!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2021
CommentsContent: I've been occasionally using this knife for around 4 months with little to no issues. The knife is still sharp and the lock mechanism seems to be fine too. I do only use this to mainly cut boxes, but it's serving well for my purpose. The colors are also quite pretty too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2017
CommentsContent: Driving home today, I witnessed a car flip into a ditch. I pulled over with other people to help. Approaching the car that was flipped I heard "SOMEONE GET ME A KNIFE!!" as there were two infants still in their child seats in the back. I offered up mine to the person in the car and they were out in seconds. Everyone was fine, ncluding the infants. The guy who got them out later on asked about the knife. I told him it was a search & recue knife from Tac Force on Amazon for about $15. He said it cut through the seat belts & straps like a lightsaber. Great job Tac Force! This will always be on me for now on.

CommentsTitle: Doesn't open unless pressed on hard surface
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2021
CommentsContent: It's supposed to be a knife that opens with one hand.  It only opens with one hand and a desk or table to press the opening button down with.  Would return, but the choice was losing $12 or possibly getting covid waiting on line at usps.  Threw out, will take the hit

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2019
CommentsContent: This knife is awesome, I get compliments from it at work all the time. The open assist is super smooth and simple to use and it stays locked really well. The only time it's opened when it wasn't supposed to was when I dropped it on a concrete floor. It holds an edge really nicely and it's pretty easy to sharpen. None of the color has come of except the black coating on the clip. It's a really nice weight and sits in the hand very nicely, and I have small/ medium hands. Super glad I got this knife and it's an amazing price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 2, 2019
CommentsContent: Super convenient to use. Really enjoy opening and closing this knife. Assisted spring makes it feel badass and easy to open one handed. To close this knife, you just need to push down on the metal bar that locks the knife open (the sharp blade facing you), and then bend the blade down. Make sure to read up on knife laws because they can vary from state to state. 3.5” is the max blade length in WA state.

CommentsTitle: Extremely sharp, no so confident grip
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 16, 2018
CommentsContent: Blade is extremely sharp and has seemed to hold up for my use (box cutting and fishing mostly). I rated 4/5 because once this handle is wet or you have a light amount of grease on your hands, the grip becomes very loose. The grip itself is all smooth metal where as a rubber grip of the same design would prevent the slippage.Pros:- Blade is sharp and has held up- Great color and quality- Lock-out mechanism is sturdy and reliableCons:- Grip will not be as strong due to moisture and or grease (compared to similar knifes with a rubber grip)- Bottle opener is mediocre

CommentsTitle: so this can easily be opened one-handed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2015
CommentsContent: Weight : 121g/4.26oz3.5" blade. The first 40% or so of the blade is serrated in a wavy 2-3-3 pattern. The quick release is operated with your index finger,  so this can easily be opened one-handed. The lock mechanism is pushed aside with your thumb (right-handed) or fingers (left-handed). This knife is attractive and does not feel cheap. It has heft and sharpness. One large and three small torx screws on each side hold it together. One side of the blade says "TAC-FORCE SPEEDSTER MODEL" and the other side says "TF-705 440 STAINLESS USA DESIGN Handmade in China." The belt clip is held by an additional three screws.I appreciate that the knife feels tight in its operation. I have cut through masking tape, plastic, bubble wrap and paper; all butter.

CommentsTitle: ... TAC Force Tactical Folding Knife is one of the best buy for your money if you are looking for ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 22, 2016
CommentsContent: This TAC Force Tactical Folding Knife is one of the best buy for your money if you are looking for a rainbow colored flipping knife. This knife is also sharp that I almost cut myself by admiring the craftsmanship of this knife. It's also a speedster model which assist the knife with a type of spring that would pop/flip the knife with a blink of an eye. I mostly, usually carry this with me when I go out anywhere. The knife also has a great holding grip and a tight pocket clip. I think this product might of came with a tool for the screws but I've misplaced them soon as I opened this product. And the price that I got this knife for at the time was about around $10 USD, so hopefully you get it in a great discounted price. Enjoy your products guys/gals and be safe to not hurt yourself.Other than that this product I would highly recommend buying for first time knife owners or if you have a knife already it would be a good buy for a change. If anyone has further questions feel free to leave your questions in the comments with this review.

CommentsTitle: If you are a Tradesman that will use daily expect 3 months.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2021
CommentsContent: I worked apartment Maintenance for 12 years & broke allot of knives. The quality has been improving. The set screws usually fall out after 3 months.  By then I have damaged the blade enough that I have a back up and rotate it out to a newer one. This is a good disposable knife that lasts just long enough.  Also sharpens easy once a week.

CommentsTitle: Love the feel and color options... But issue with fasteners?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Love these knives and have bought several but had issues with three of them so far. The small torx screws come loose and get lost and no luck trying to find replacement fasteners. So now when I get a new one I take the fasteners out and put threadlock on them and not had any issues since. Is there a way to reach the manufacturer to see about getting my knives repaired/replaced under the lifetime warranty or see if they can send out new fasteners to replace what has fallen out. I have tried calling and email but no luck...

CommentsTitle: Worth the money, very dangerous though so be careful
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This knife is super sharp. So sharp that I accidentally cut myself almost immediately so I never opened it again lol. It’s definitely dangerous so be careful. If you really need a knife I would suggest buying this. It was worth the price. It’s very nice looking as well.I didn’t know the knife had a lock feature, so I actually thought the knife had rusted and I tried hammering it shut, throwing it on the ground and it would not unlock at all haha. I then decided to read the reviews and realized it was the lock. So the lock feature is 11/10

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 4, 2016
CommentsContent: This is the second knife I've bought of this brand for personal safety and utility. The first delivery sent me the wrong item, but Amazon was GREAT with the mistake and expedited a replacement knife the very next day.I recently was helping with a large event - and this super came in handy. I wasn't sure how sharp it would be (given it just looks really pretty and pointy)...but it stood up to sticky gaff tape, cutting zip ties on the fly, and breaking down heavy boxes. I know that's not really a true test of a knife, but it open-assist was really handy -- to be able to flip the knife open with one hand. My girlfriends were impressed by how pretty it looked though...and the dudes impressed that my knife was bigger than theirs :)

CommentsTitle: It's weighted well and the colored blade adds a touch of femininity to a pretty masculine product
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2016
CommentsContent: This knife is not only sharp looking (haha see what I did there?) but very durable and well made! It's weighted well and the colored blade adds a touch of femininity to a pretty masculine product. I unfortunately ended up returning it but not by any fault of the product. Unfortunately it has a tiny bit of an assist when it opens up, which makes switching it open a breeze, however I wasn't sure if cops in NYC would consider this a "switch blade" function, even though it clearly isn't. I personally didn't want to take the risk, but if you live in a lenient city where a small assist is OK then this knife is an awesome choice!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2015
CommentsContent: Especially for the price I paid for it ($8.12) this was a steal. I have always had the boyish desire to own a rainbow knife, so when I saw the price, I jumped on it (on the deal, not the knife) ;)The knife is well-built with a clip on the back that you could use to clip to a pocket or something.The assisted release mechanism is really nice, smoothly opening the knife, even with one hand (although it is easier with two).The rainbow sheen is quite pretty, and is not just limited to the blade itself.The grip is also well-shaped.No complaints; boyish fantasy fulfilled.I did NOT receive a free/discounted sample for an "unbiased" review. I wish! :P Nope. I forked over the dough.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2021
CommentsContent: It came pretty sharp out of the box and the serrated edge is even sharp enough on the tips to cut. the lock release is easy to use and it doesn't hurt your thumb because its pretty wide due to the shape of the frame. i like the little hole in the knife because it can be used to push out the blade for it to spring out. the glass breaker at the end is pretty good, it causes a lot of pain when hit by it while being mostly non lethal. the glass breaker could even be sharpened if that's your thing.

CommentsTitle: Have been using it for months and it still works
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: It isn't the sharpest knife, but it works well, the blade is thick and not bendy. It looks really nice and shiny still even after all this time of me using it. I like the lock mechanism, it feels safe, you wouldn't accidentally unlock it.

CommentsTitle: Great buy but no instructions for us amateurs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This is the first time ever buying a knife and I just love this one. When it first arrived there were no Insteon how to open or close it. I had to go on YouTube to learn (that’s why I can’t give it 5 stars) but once I learned it was easy. Has a clip I can put it on and have it nearby for walks alone in the park and look wise it’s awesome

CommentsTitle: Solid knife for a really low price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2019
CommentsContent: Don't let the super-low price and sexy design fool you. I just got mine delivered today and I'm very impressed with the quality of the parts and construction. The blade came with a razor-sharp factory edge and locks into place securely when opened. It's very easy to open and close with one hand. Despite the fact that it simply looks like it might not be, the handle is also quite comfortable in both my left and right hands.

CommentsTitle: An great knife and incredible value for your money!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this knife for my daughter and she absolutely loves it. The ergonomic design of the knife, the lock feature (that's a must) and the overall value for the money. It's a beautiful knife and I would recommend  to anyone in the market for a great quality knife. I would definitely purchase again.

CommentsTitle: Great for the price, but has some flaws.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Its a really good knife. The only 2 drawbacks are, it comes kinda sharp, but not very sharp. And idk about you guys but I ain't the knife sharpener guy, id probably just mess it up lol. So that sucks. But also the spring assist feature works well, but not all the time... I'd say about 1 in every 15 times you use it, it won't work. And those are decent odds, but when it comes down to life or death, you don't want any odds lol.. overall, for the price, this thing is really well designed, made decently, looks cool.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2015
CommentsContent: Real cool knife. I enjoy flipping it in and out. Though, it's not sharp at all and you'll probably have to sharpen it yourself.Also, if you get the rainbow variant and you touch it a lot, the oils from your skin make the colors real dark.I think I actually like the darker colors anyways. More manly. Heh.**Edit** I just gave the rainbow knife to my girlfriend and bought the grey variant and I've noticed it's not quite as good mechanically. When I first received it, it wouldn't flip out all the way and lock.. so I had to loosen it up a bit. Still, it doesn't flip out quite as solidly as the rainbow one, most likely because of the paint. Still a good knife, though.

CommentsTitle: I like the feel in my hand
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2015
CommentsContent: Wanted a knife to carry in my purse. Bought the rainbow because it is girly enough without going overboard. Very sharp right out of the box. I like the feel in my hand. Only drawback is the single handed open. My husband has a Kabar with a nipple on the blade that allows you to flip the blade with your thumb, and I love that. This knife however has a nipple on the back of the blade that you drag back with a finger, then the blade pops open with the assist feature. So it does open very quickly. Shutting it is also somewhat of a challenge. It unlocks easily and shuts about halfway easily. The remaining halfway is more difficult and requires a good bit of force. I'm sure this is to prevent someone from inadvertently shutting their finger in it, but it makes me more scared that will happen because I'm struggling to close it. I feel like this will loosen up as time goes on though.Overall, would recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve had this knife for a few days now, I haven’t really used it a lot, mostly have just opened other Amazon packages. It looks really nice, feels nice in the hand as well. The only issue with the knife is that the lock mechanism feels a bit sketchy. Sometimes I have a problem closing the knife but it hasn’t been much of a problem. If it does become an issue within the following months I might make an update but overall good quality for the price I paid. If you plan to use it for heavy duty work I’d recommend looking for something more effective but otherwise I still think it’s a good purchase.

CommentsTitle: Cool to have around the house, not sure how useful it would be in an emergency.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 7, 2020
CommentsContent: The knife seems to stick a bit opening and closing. For that reason, I wouldn't rely on it in an emergency situation. However, for opening Amazon boxes around the house, it serves its purpose.It is also worth noting that the packaging has a Prop 65 warning, if that's something you care about.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I cannot believe the quality of this knife for only $7. I am straight up impressed with this knife. Looks amazing, feels great to open, and seems like a sturdy enough build for easy every day use. I'm sure if your slamming it on hard material it won't hold up, but hey it's $7 and all I use it for is opening boxes and maybe for self defense if I get caught in a bad spot with it.

CommentsTitle: The rainbow blade is my Ally. The bottle opener maybe not so much
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2017
CommentsContent: I love that these Knives have such color variety, and I had to get the rainbow blade! It doesn't come super sharp but it's not bent or seem to be used in any way. I know how to take care of a knife so I'll sharpen it myself. It flips just like it's supposed to and I like how I can get a firm grip on its handle. I'm a little unsure about using the bottle opener with how position right next to the tip of the blade because I don't want to dull the end of the knife. I don't know if I'll ever use the glass breaker but it's better to have and not need it than to need and not have.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2020
CommentsContent: This knife is a great value. It has proven to be an excellent knife to use around the farm. I always leave it in my car so it is handy whenever I need it.Though, I did read reviews about it opening unintentionally so I don’t leave it in my pocket for long.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2019
CommentsContent: Very lightweight and easy to use. Extremely useful and definitely gets the job done. The blade didn’t come too sharp but it wasn’t dull either. I’d say it’s a good beginner blade for anyone needing it in college or for going out with girlfriends. The assist to open it really springs it out quickly and it locks nicely. Fits well in your hand and very comfortably.

CommentsTitle: Worked well before it fell apart.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Now, let me say that this knife looks awesome, and it worked well for a while. It cut the way a knife was supposed to cut, the opening and closing was smooth, and it seemed like a great product.The problem is that it decided to loose some screws and basically fell apart.Now, it didn't phisically separate from the handle, but the handle will shift a solid 6cm. Now, I may not be an expert on knives, but I'm pretty sure it's not supposed to do that.In conclusion,  looks awesome, but may fall apart if you actually use it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2021
CommentsContent: Good size, super pretty, good weight. I love it! Haven't tested sharpness YET, BUT WILL. On a box not my siblings lmao (please don't come at me) but I like it! Kinda hard to open but it'll become a muscle memory thing

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I was shocked at how beautiful this knife was when I got it for such a good price. The only problem I had is that it's a bit difficult to open, so I have to pull the blade out separately (which isn't much of a problem but it can be a little difficult!)It's such a nice knife, and it cuts really well. It doesn't get that dirty, and if it does it's very easy to clean. I recommend!

CommentsTitle: Great knife. a little heavy though
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2019
CommentsContent: Appears to be a really good knife. The blade is super sharp. It locks in place without any wiggling.  The only thing which bothered me was the weight. It's too heavy. It does have a clip on it so you can belt it if you want, but it's just too heavy to keep in your pocket (for me). For the price it is a great value. I don't know how they manage to sell it so cheap. Robotics I guess.

CommentsTitle: It keeps me safe and it is beautiful
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I love the color and is very sharp. I carry it everywhere I go. When I'm walking to the store or just over to a friend's house, it's my sidekick. It is extremely sharp and it took me a while to get use to the weight and opening it quickly but it is a wonderful knife.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Holy cow, this knife is so sharp! It's cool looking as well but thought the design was a little odd. I need to look at the knife for a few seconds to figure out where to pull on to get the blade out. Minor detail, so I didn't hit the rating for it, but the opposite side looks like you should pull there as well. Nit picky, but overall a great pocket knife!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2017
CommentsContent: Pros:Sharp. I feel safer having it. Nice color options.Cons:A little difficult to close (will hurt the heck out of your hand if done incorrectly). Wish they had included quick directions for opening/closing. I had to YouTube some videos on how to close the thing having never used a tactical knife before. I wish it had more grip - it's real slippery. I feel like if I went to reach for it in an emergency situation it would slip right out of my grasp. I don't have calloused hands so I feel everything and my hands are very oily.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2017
CommentsContent: I got this as a gift, and the recipient absolutely loved it. The color is definitely different, and it almost looks nautical (something a diver should have on hand for emergencies). There's a slick sheen over the blade and other metal parts, but that doesn't affect performance in any way. It's just an interesting texture. Knife is sharp, it's got a nice weight to it, and it's very eye catching. For the price, this is an absolute steal. Highly recommended!

CommentsTitle: Sharp, great value for your money, perfect gift!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2020
CommentsContent: Great value for the money, Great christmas present. Perfect item to carry in your purse for protection too. I love the colors!!! Fast shipping! Going to order two more for presents for those that collect knives!!

CommentsTitle: I received this knife used and scratched up
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I received this knife used and scratched up. There are marks all over it! Very disappointed I was expecting a beautiful knife and I got a used scratched up knife. It’s so scratched up polishing it doesn’t even help and bang marks like the color is just coded scratched through.

CommentsTitle: Gorgeous knife. Definitely worth the price.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2019
CommentsContent: This product honestly came prettier than I expected. Definitely in love with the look. I'm probably just going to keep this one in my car so I don't ruin it opening boxes like my other knife. The only issue I had with it was how to close it once you opened it. I YouTubed it and figured out you just have to push the bottom oval-looking piece a to the side, but other than that is is great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2017
CommentsContent: Gibbs rule #9: "Never go anywhere without a knife."I bought the rainbow-hued TAC Force TF-705RB just for fun, but it is a pretty good knife. Although it looks like an oddball Klingon Bat'leth, the grip is surprisingly firm and comfortable. The blade has a nice edge, but the serrated section is freakin' wicked sharp.The TAC Force knife arrived in two days in a nice black box. When it arrived the hinge screw was a little too tight and opening the blade was a real fight. I loosened the screw a hair and now I can use the TAC Force as a flip knife.Note that the blade locks in the open position and you need to press an interior bar to close the knife. The clip is pretty useless, IMO, since it leaves part of the handle protruding from your pocket. Others will likely feel differently.But at the price, this is a real five star bargain.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020
CommentsContent: So cheap great fo the money- i use this a a general everyday knife- keep it hooked on my pants and take it everywhere. Nice serated edge, came sharp, beautiful color. Nice weight and grip to it. Gets lots of compliments on this knife.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2019
CommentsContent: This is an incredibly nice knife for this price point, much more solid than I expected. It arrives sharper than many knives like this do as well, which is nice. The clip to keep it on the edge of your pocket or tool belt was somewhat loose when it arrived but it was easy enough to unscrew it and bend it to be tighter. I got the rainbow finish and it looks absolutely amazing!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2018
CommentsContent: I bought this as a gift for my knife enthusiast friend. She absolutely loves it and takes it everywhere. The rainbow oil slick color is even prettier in person! It has some weight to it and it’s pretty sturdy, the knife was a little hard to open at first but after playing with a few times it was smooth as butter. It’s been roughly a year since she’s had it and it’s still in great condition and sharp! The blade was a little wobbly after a few months but she just tightened the screw and it was good as new. I’m tempted to buy one for myself! 10/10 would recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This knife is a good size and it fits your hands well (specifically if you have small hands like me). The colors are so pretty, but even more importantly, the knife is functional. The only drawback is that it doesn't have a seatbelt cutting option. That being said, I'd purchase another one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2021
CommentsContent: My fiance and I love these knives. We both have one and I ordered another as a gift for someone and they love it. The bottle opener part is a little useless because of where it's located.. but other than that the knife is sturdy, looks good and easy to carry in my pocket.

CommentsTitle: Fine for an EDC you don’t mind losing.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2018
CommentsContent: Sturdy product. Hard to open easy to close. Very sharp not sure how well it will hold the edge but will find out in time. The knife itself is slippery and hard to hold onto might be dangerous to use for any sort of stabbing action but I really only use it for cutting.Company sent me the wrong knife I would have returned it but my girlfriend wanted this one so she bought me one and we hope it’s right this time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2021
CommentsContent: Very pretty & it’s at an affordable price. However, opening and closing the blade is very unsafe because you have to manually open & close it by holding the blade with your fingers. Not sure if mine is defective or what. It also doesn’t stay locked into place when open.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2018
CommentsContent: Great knife that I use all the time. It is always coming in handy when I need to cut packages open or even when I need a screwdriver. I carry this in my purse at all times, which helps me feel a little safer. I plan on getting another one to keep in my car as well to use to break the window should the need ever arise (I live in Houston so a flooded car isn't too unlikely). Great quality knife with a very sharp blade and the rainbow is really pretty. Very cool knife.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2019
CommentsContent: I've had this knife for about 9 months now and I have nothing negative to say about it. The design is smooth and ergonomic, and the knife is very pretty. It's also very sharp and does not have trouble cutting through anything. So sharp that it cut effortlessly into my finger when I got a little careless with it. I've used it not too frequently since I've had it, but the spring in it seems to be just fine, no slack in it and still locks in the open position just fine. If you're looking for a functional knife that's also nice to looks at, I highly recommend this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020

CommentsTitle: Bought this knife many times - they have raised price by over 50%
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2021
CommentsContent: Price hike not good, was such a value before.  The opening of the knife can at times be problematic.  I have had to bend the metal and add WD-40 in the past to have it work properly again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2018
CommentsContent: Opened it and accidentally gently poked my finger with one of the serrated points and immediately started bleeding. Very sharp. Great quality.Also fairly easy to open after a couple times and clicks into place firmly; nicely weighted.I liked it so much that I bought it as a Christmas gift for six of my queer friends in December 2016 in honor of the incoming president. I use it for everything from opening up boxes and cutting fruit to carrying around sketchy parts of town at night.Only complaint is that the bottle opener seems pretty badly placed--you need to open the knife to actually use it, which seems inadvisable if you're trying to crack open your third bottle of beer or whatever. Personally doesn't matter as much to me since I mostly only carry it around for the knife and window breaker bit (always good for emergencies), but I feel like it might be better replaced with the seatbelt cutter that similar designs sometimes have instead.

Everything else is really nice and pretty but THE LEVER GIVES ME ISSUES. WHAT DO I LOOK LIKE TRYING TO PULL OUT A SPRING ASSISTED KNIFE THAT I NEED TO OPEN BY THE BLADE BECAUSE LEVER IS TOO HARD TO OPEN, HUH? WHAT DO I LOOK LIKE >:(Overall 8/10, I love it, Its also heavy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021

And for course I've had to show it off, everyone loves it! Really great knife for the price, would highly recommend.

CommentsTitle: Good value. Looks nice. Handle is a little weird.

CommentsContent: I was NOT expecting to like this knife as much as I do. Depending on how calloused or not your digits are, expect it to be a rough few days, but I'm pretty sure that's just cause it's new. Give it time to break in and it'll be fine.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2016
CommentsContent: As far as my knife collection goes, this is the best one yet. I love the blade color and design and the flame shape of the handle makes it comfortable and natural to grip. Typically the clip is either too loose that it slips or so tight that you can't clip it to anything easily but this one is perfect resistance and has a high lip at the end which makes for easy pocketing. The blade was sharp right out of the box and the spring assist is strong. This is my favorite knife.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2020

CommentsTitle: I like how great the quality is

Haven't had to use that yet.I've used it for several months, and it seems to have kept it's edge.The only bad thing is that the rainbow-surface shows smudges easily.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2018

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2014
CommentsContent: First out of the box, the knife smelled of sweatshop and grease. Knife was slippery and extremely sharp. After I figured out where the open lever was, I noticed just how big this knife was. The clip is very sturdy and latches onto anything and does not move. Blade doesn't wiggle when folded and it takes a bit to get it open so don't worry about it being in your pocket. Glass breaker on the rear of the handle takes a few hits to pop open a window and dulls quickly. Color is good, but I did get the wrong color. Overall, the knife smells funny for a bit, knife is huge in your pocket, glass breaker works twice, and it is incredibly sharp. 4/5

CommentsTitle: Sturdy and easy opening with practice

I have a small knife but it's so small it wouldn't e a good self defense weapon. the clip will allow me to clip it to my outside pocket of my purse for easy access. Course with Amazon Prime I got it so fast!  Love my Prime!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2020
CommentsContent: Sharp, moderately easy to use, easy to carry and conceal, gets the job done whatever it may be. Stay safe with this object, never fling it open and always fold back when finished.

After a year or so the locking mechanism became less secure but if you have the correct tools you may be able to correct it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2020
CommentsContent: EVERYTHING ON THIS KNIFE IS WELL MADE. I CHOSE THE RAINBOW COLOR AND BOY DOES IT SHINE IN THE SuN. IT IS A BIT TOUGH TO OPEN WITH ONE HAND BUT ALL I DID WAS SPRAY WD40 AND IT OPENS SMOOTHLY. this knife is awesome . i will definitely be ordering more.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: I have a hug addiction on collecting stuff and pocket knife is one of them. This particular item really stand out, sharp, and it has a bottle opener! I use this more to cut orange and other foods but I would recommend is you’re trying to build a  collection or just want something sharp for cutting!  (Keeping it simple and short for you guys)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2015
CommentsContent: I like to keep this on me for everyday use, and for my peace of mind when walking alone at night.This knife is spring-assisted, so you will have to apply a force on the hinge in order for the blade to flip out. You can fold it closed by pushing the lock (located beneath the blade) out of the way with your finger and carefully folding in the knife with your free hand. You might find it hard to open the blade the first few times - but I've found it becomes easier after having used it over time. Others might suggest you could use tools on it or apply a lubricant on the blade hinge, but do this at your own risk.The blade comes sharp out of the box, but can dull over time depending on how much you use it. Consider purchasing a blade sharpener depending on your usage of this.There's a clip on the side of the blade that allows you to slip it into your pocket or on your hip for a discrete carry. I do either from time-to-time, and sometimes I forget its even there because it fits so well. Knife comes with glass-breaker and bottle opener. Note that you cannot use the bottle opener unless the knife is unfolded, which might be somewhat unsafe.For hunting, or other "heavy" uses, I would recommend looking for something a bit more durable. Otherwise, I recommend this for general, everyday use.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2019
CommentsContent: Looks beautiful and came as described. Only problem is I bought two knives, (they were the same), one for me and one for my brother, and the one that I kept was made sloppier than the first. Wasn't as sharp and the serrated edges look like the cuts were miscalculated. But nevertheless I love my knife and I take it with me everywhere, but it's resigned to really just being a work knife for me now.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2021
CommentsContent: This knife is my best friend. It's sharp, lightweight, and has several convenient features. The bottle opener, glass breaker, and serrated edge come in very handy on my ranch. I would definitely recommend this tac knife to anyone looking for a great knife at an awesome price.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2019
CommentsContent: This is one of the most beautiful knives! Catches everyone’s eye; Everyone is always asking where I got it. I’m 100% satisfied would most definitely order again, maybe another color? Either way if your looking I would just add it to the bag.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 10, 2017
CommentsContent: The prices on the TAC Force/MTech knives are so low that I have always thought they must be poor quality. Found this one in a local store and was pleasantly surprised at how solid, crisp and sharp it was. Bought it and then bought again on Amazon for half the price. Only one problem: the spring assist is a negative feature. The extra resistance that the spring makes necessary to hold the blade closed makes it harder, not easier, to open. The MTech version I bought at the store is not spring assisted and much easier to flip open one handed.

CommentsTitle: Sharp and beautiful. Easy to use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Been wanting a knife like this, got this a a great price and works great. My husband now says I am like Gibbs in NCIS now using this knife like a pro on almost everything. Lol

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2015
CommentsContent: I didn't expect anything more than a knife that looked cool, obviously because of the low price. I was already aware that the bottle opener is extremely impractical because I read read quite a few reviews before I made my purchase so I wasn't disappointed at all. It is great quality for the price I paid but if you are looking for a knife to use on a daily basis you are one cheap son of a b****. This knife is to look cool and to use every once in awhile (you should be able to tell because of the price). Side note if your the type to loctite everything make sure you have a torx T6.

CommentsContent: The knife was up to standards that I had expected, and was tight and fairly sharpe, but with little effort was very sharpe and what little I used it I beleive it will hold an edge.  Considering the price and what I received in a timely manner ahead of time quoted I think it's a very good knife at a very low price.  If I lose,break, or someone walks off with it I won't be out a bunch of money, and if I need to abuse it I won't worry but will pry, chisel or unscrew with it,at the risk of breaking off the tip or snapping it in half,but with what labor cost verses knife cost if it saves a 1/2 hour of going after another tool break it!  Give it to a deserving youngster for camping fishing or what ever and order another gladly.

CommentsTitle: sturdy knife with an incredibly sharp blade

CommentsContent: I bought this knife to help me feel safe at my college campus but I mainly use it as a tool to cut ropes and open packages and whatnot. CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2014
CommentsContent: I purchased this knife to add to my everday carry items (phone, wallet, keys). I wanted this knife primarily for protection and self defense. I am 18 and not of age to buy and conceal carry a handgun so I figured this was the next best thing. I don't know very much about knives, but this knife seems to be very sturdy and well made. It feels good in your hand. The spring assist does its job and alows the knife to be opened one-handed with relative ease. I have only one minor gripe about this knife and it is the placement of the glass breaker. When opening the knife it may poke your hand depending on the placement of your grip, but as I have said it is only minor because in order to avoid this you just have to adjust your grip slightly. I also really like the color of the blade. I was worried it might be a little too feminine, but I was wrong. It gives the knife a unique look that really stands out and looks great for either sex.PROS:CostLooksSolid ConstructionGood Spring AssistPerfect WeightFairly SharpCONS:Placement of glass breaker may poke the users hand (again, minor but worth noting)I only received the knife today so I cannot speak on how long it lasts, but based on everything that I observe I would be willing to bet it will last some time. Solid knife at a price that cannot be turned down. Would recommend to anyone. Thank you.

CommentsTitle: Sweet knife at a ridiculously cheap price!  A no brainer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2015
CommentsContent: Shipping: Pretty quick even as I live in Canada. Bubble lined envelope was used and the wrapping on the outside was good, inside the packaging tho not so much. This is more of the manufacturer's problem tho.Knife: Feels pretty solid in hand but not too heavy, screws are tight and blade is solidly mounted. The blade is shaped pretty well and the "rainbow" finish is evenly coated on. Opening mechanism is smooth and feels satisfying, closing lock is a bit hard to push away but still acceptable. Black anodizing on the body looks good but not very durable. It's not rubbing off per say but can be scratched fairly easily. Some how clipping it on my jeans induced a few scratches and then when I used it to open a bottle of beer it did a bit of damage as well. Doesn't bother me much but something to keep in mind for heavy duty users or perfectionist. Ergonomics are okay, certain holding positions are better as it has a curve to its handle. Main issue is probably factory defects, have 2 scratches right out of the box as well as a semi-rounded screw.Quick summeryPros: Looks cool  Solid feel  Smooth action  Sharpened bladeCons: Minor factory defects  OK ergonomics  Need to open blade to use bottle opener

   I have had this knife for almost a year now and I’m in love. It is still incredibly sharp and I only sharpen it every month or so. It opens easily but I’ve never had it accidentally open on me. I don’t see myself having to buy a new one anytime soon but if I ever lose it I’m definitely getting another one of these knives!

My oldest son, the Marine says this, "I use this knife every day.  It's my work knife, my hunting, camping, farming, fishing, and self-defense knife...my everything knife.
